intro: Clibadium zarucchii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, round, yellow fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
